cells.code:
Here's how string interpolation works in Ruby: 
- when Ruby finds `#{name}` in this string
- then it will evaluate the piece of Ruby code `name` 
- the value of `name` gets inserted into the string

name = 'Oscar'
age = Math.sqrt(81)
puts "Hello, #{name}! You are #{age} years old!"

output: Hello, Oscar! You are 9.0 years old!

cells.code:
Javascript uses the same concept, but with slightly different syntax: 
- use `$` instead of `#` in front of the curly braces
- surround the string with backticks (`) instead of quotations
